Body: In forms like Claudio's house or Claudio's dogs, are there languages in which the Claudio's would change depending on gender and number of the houses or dogs?
Title: Are there any languages where the genitive case changes according to its object?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
GlaDOS project manager at Aperture Science, Inc.

I discovered a truly remarkable demonstration of P=NP that this About Me section is too small to contain.
